text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we started to see how people lived together. We saw this through things like cave paintings. No one knows the connection between this and language. Brains did not suddenly get bigger. But humans became more complex and more intelligent. Did using language make their brains develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

best_attempt.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, however, we started to see the evidence of early human civilisation, for example, through cave paintings. No one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?
